description: Code indicating the current lifecycle state of the work order (e.g., open, closed, canceled); confirm code set with SME.
Maintenance category for the job: corrective (CM) versus preventive/scheduled (PM).
Unique identifier of the work order associated with this asset line.
Short text describing the maintenance job scope and system/component involved.
Date and time the work order was created/issued.
Date and time the work order was closed/completed.
Planned or target completion date for the work.
Identifier of the technician or employee assigned to perform the work.
Supervisor responsible for overseeing this work order; likely an employee ID; confirm with SME.
Crew leader in charge of the work team; likely an employee ID; confirm with SME.
Code indicating how the work originated (e.g., driver report, inspection, PM); confirm code definitions with SME.
Identifier for the original/primary work request associated with this work order; confirm linkage rules with SME.
Identifier of the person who approved the work order; confirm approval workflow with SME.
Type of customer requesting service (e.g., internal department, external); confirm allowed values with SME.
Identifier of the requesting customer or department.
Name of the customer or department requesting service.
Requester’s mobile phone number.
Requester’s alternate phone number.
Requester’s email address.
Identifier for the portal/account used to submit or track the request; confirm with SME.
Operator/driver associated with the asset or request; likely an employee/operator ID; confirm with SME.
External issue/ticket reference tied to this work; confirm source system with SME.
Short statement of the requester’s problem or service need.
Additional comments provided by the requester at submission.
Supervisor’s notes or instructions related to the work.
Code indicating urgency or priority level of the work; meanings of T/NT/W need confirmation with SME.
Detailed description of the requester’s issue or service request.
Intake notes captured during request creation.
Reference key to the service location address record; confirm source with SME.
Street name for the service location.
Street number for the service location.
City for the service location.
Postal/ZIP code for the service location.
Descriptive location details (e.g., yard, bay, landmark) for where work occurs.
Nearest cross street to the service location.
Timestamp when this record was added to the system.
User or process that created the record (e.g., data conversion job).
User-defined text field for work-order-level custom data; usage varies by business unit.

User-defined date field at the work-order level; purpose varies by configuration.
User-defined date field at the work-order level; purpose varies by configuration.
User-defined date field at the work-order level; purpose varies by configuration.
User-defined numeric field at the work-order level; purpose varies by configuration.
User-defined numeric field at the work-order level; purpose varies by configuration.
User-defined numeric field at the work-order level; purpose varies by configuration.
Narrative of the work performed, findings, and resolution.
Related ticket/memo number associated with this work; likely a cross-reference; confirm with SME.
Identifier of the originating work request linked to this work order.
Name of the work group/shop responsible for the job.
Project identifier if the work is billed or tracked under a project.
Account or department to be billed for the work.
Identifier of an external vendor performing or supplying part of the work.
Code categorizing the type of activity at the work-order level (e.g., repair, inspection); confirm code list.
Management unit or cost center responsible for the work order.
Accounting/GL account charged at the work-order level.
Code for the facility or shop where the work order is handled.
Indicator of work-in-progress status at the work-order level; code meanings require SME confirmation.
Sequence number referencing the asset entry on this work order; confirm usage with SME.
Line sequence for the asset within the work order, used when multiple assets are involved; confirm with SME.
Unique identifier/unit number of the asset being serviced.
Code representing the asset’s class/type (e.g., vehicle, equipment); confirm code set with SME.
Descriptive name/details of the asset.
Identifier for the asset subsystem/component involved in the repair; confirm with SME.
Code describing the reported problem/failure mode; confirm code set with SME.
Text description of the failure or symptom observed.
Percentage of total work order cost allocated to this asset line.
Numeric rating related to this job (e.g., severity, quality, or satisfaction); meaning requires SME confirmation.
Date the work on this asset line was completed.
Optional free-form field for additional information; purpose varies by site.
Optional free-form field for additional information; purpose varies by site.
Asset downtime attributed to this job, typically in hours.
User-defined text field at the asset/line level; usage varies by business unit.
User-defined text field at the asset/line level; usage varies by business unit.

Indicator of in-progress status for this asset line; code meanings require SME confirmation.
Accounting/GL account charged for this asset line.
Code identifying the shop, facility, or organizational location performing the work.
Code categorizing the specific maintenance activity performed on the asset; confirm code list.
Management unit or cost center responsible for this asset line.
Geospatial location of the work/site (point or shape); coordinate system and precision require SME confirmation.
Date and time work began on this asset.
Date and time work on this asset finished; may differ from work order close time.
Department or entity that owns the asset.
Remarks about the asset relevant to this job.
Total actual cost recorded for this asset line.
Quantity of work completed (e.g., tasks or measured units) for this line.
Actual labor hours spent on this asset line.
Actual labor cost charged to this asset line.
Actual equipment/usage cost charged to this asset line.
Actual parts/materials cost charged to this asset line.
Actual miscellaneous costs charged to this asset line.
Actual contractor/sublet cost charged to this asset line.
Sum of all actual costs for this asset line.
Odometer or hour-meter reading of the asset at the time of service.
